intro: Gardenia suffruticosa, commonly known as the Florida gardenia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters, featuring glossy, dark green leaves. The plant produces fragrant, white flowers with yellow stamens, which bloom in the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it a popular ornamental plant. Its botanical characteristics make it well-suited for coastal and humid climates.
